texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Containers are a great way to deliver and run all kinds of applications. Although many people build containers for server applications, you can also use them for client applications on your local workstation. This helps when you want to test new applications without disrupting your existing system or when you use an immutable system such as  Fedora Silverblue .
texts.text: Containers are a great way to deliver and run all kinds of applications. Although many people build containers for server applications, you can also use them for client applications on your local workstation. This helps when you want to test new applications without disrupting your existing system or when you use an immutable system such as  Fedora Silverblue .

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Podman takes this further by allowing you to run a client application without root access or daemons. This post covers how to build a container with an Xorg application and run it on a Fedora system.
